item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, April 29, 2025 at 8:20 PM UTC
item.description:

2. I made my AI think harder by making it argue with itself (201 points | 84 comments)
3. Everything we announced at our first-ever LlamaCon (73 points | 37 comments)

6. ArkFlow: High-performance Rust stream processing engine (106 points | 21 comments)
7. LibreLingo – FOSS Alternative to Duolingo (623 points | 292 comments)
8. Performance optimization is hard because it's fundamentally a brute-force task (179 points | 77 comments)
9. Indian court orders blocking of Proton Mail (184 points | 74 comments)
10. I use zip bombs to protect my server (79 points | 27 comments)

12. Programming languages should have a tree traversal primitive (131 points | 110 comments)
13. Hestus, Inc. (YC S24) Is Hiring an ML Engineer to Revolutionize CAD ( | hide)
14. China's Clinical Trial Boom (32 points | 2 comments)

21. Beyond Performance: Measuring the Environmental Impact of Analytical Databases (7 points | 1 comment)
22. Why did Windows 7 log on slower for months if you had a solid color background? (473 points | 261 comments)
23. Gaussian Splatting Meets ROS2 (44 points | 12 comments)
24. AirBorne: Wormable zero-click remote code execution (RCE) in AirPlay protocol (23 points | 3 comments)
25. Try Switching to Kagi (480 points | 337 comments)
26. What happens at the end of 'Trading Places'? (2013) (46 points | 11 comments)
27. How to build Intrinsic Motivation: a review of the science (109 points | 22 comments)
28. The One-Person Framework in Practice (351 points | 140 comments)
29. Generative AI is not replacing jobs or hurting wages at all, say economists (299 points | 429 comments)
